definitions.definition: A kind or helpful deed; an instance of voluntarily assisting (someone).
definitions.example: He did me a favor when he took the time to drive me home.

definitions.definition: A small gift; a party favor.
definitions.example: A marriage favour is a bunch or knot of white ribbons or white flowers worn at a wedding.

definitions.definition: Mildness or mitigation of punishment; lenity.
The object of regard; person or thing favoured.
Anything worn publicly as a pledge of a woman's favor.
To look upon fondly; to prefer.
To do a favor [noun sense 1] for; to show beneficence toward.
definitions.example: Would you favor us with a poetry reading?
Favoring your sore leg will only injure the other one.

definitions.definition: (including) To resemble, to look like (another person).
